document.masterDocTitle: Leaf-rolling sawflies (Hymenoptera, Pamphiliidae, Pamphiliinae) of Tianmushan Mountains, Zhejiang Province, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Leaf-rolling sawflies (Hymenoptera, Pamphiliidae, Pamphiliinae) of Tianmushan Mountains, Zhejiang Province, China

bibRefCitation.author: Shinohara
bibRefCitation.refString: Shinohara, A. & Xiao, G. - R. (2006) Some leaf-rolling sawflies (Hymenoptera, Pamphiliidae, Pamphiliinae) from China in the collection of the Research Institute of Forest Protection, Chinese Academy of Forestry, Beijing. In: Blank, S. M., Schmidt, S. & Taeger, A. (Eds.), Recent Sawfly Research: Synthesis and Prospects. Goecke & Evers, Keltern, pp. 285 - 296.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Mature larva (prepupa) (
Fig. 8
D–F): About 15 mm , head light brown with large greenish white area including frons (except for ventral margin) and area surrounding dorsal margin of frons and blackish brown marks of various extent on parietal region; antenna light brown; trunk whitish green, with lateral and posterior margins yellowish; prothorax with very large dorsal and round dorsolateral spot blackish; cervical sclerite black; thoracic legs and subanal appendage creamy white.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Pamphilius palliceps
, remains of egg shells and larval leaf-rolls (A), adults (B, C) and larvae (D–F). A, Two larval abodes and remains of egg shells (arrowed) on leaflets of
Rosa multiflora
, April 12; B, female, April 13; C, male, April 13; D, mature larva, dorsal view, April 25; E, mature larva, head and thorax, dorsal view, April 25; F, mature larva, head and thorax, ventral view, April 25. Photographs taken in Kaishan Laodian (A–C) and in the laboratory (D–F) in 2014 by A. Shinohara.

Host plant . Rosaceae :
Rosa multiflora Thunb.
[new record].

Field observations . In April, 2014 , Shinohara found numerous adults, eggs and larvae on the leaflets of
Rosa multiflora
in Tianmushan area (
Fig. 8
A–C). On
April 12
, Shinohara collected 25 early instar larvae on the host plants along the car road from Chanyuansi to Kaishan Laodian at an altitude of 520 meters and reared them. The larva solitarily makes a leaf-roll on the underside of a leaflet. Only one larva and remains of one egg shell (rarely two larvae and two egg shells) were found per leaflet. Five larvae matured on April 24, 19 on
April 25
and one on
May 1
; they were all fixed in ethanol after maturation. In Kaishan Laodian at an altitude of 1155 meters, only the adults and eggs were found during Shinohara’s stay there from
April 8 to 16 .
Eggs were collected on
April 16
, they hatched on
April 21 to 25
, and the larvae were fixed on
May 5 .

Remarks . This species was described from "Xitianmushan, Laodian-Xianrending" (
Shinohara & Xiao 2006
). It is apparently a common pamphiliid on the mountains of Zhejiang Province. This is the first record from Anhui Province. Identification of the immature stages was based on the perfect agreement of a part of the CO 1 sequences of five larvae feeding on
Rosa multiflora
and three adults from Kaishan Laodian (Kiyoshi, personal communication).
